bulletins.title: A-post outer trim panel becomes detached.
problems: A-post outer trim panel becomes detached.
causes: A-post outer trim panel fixing clip faulty.

steps: Fit modified A-post outer trim panel fixing clip.

bulletins.title: ABS/ESP warning lamp illuminated. No communication with ABS control module.
problems: ABS/ESP warning lamp illuminated. No communication with ABS control module.
causes: ABS control module wiring harness chafing through on ABS hydraulic modulator mounting bracket.

steps: Check ABS control module wiring harness for damage and repair as necessary Fig.1170154.1.
Fit protective rubber sleeve to edge of ABS hydraulic modulator mounting bracket to prevent further damage Fig.1170154.2.
ViewView more informationFig.1170154

bulletins.title: Accelerator pedal sticking.
problems: Accelerator pedal sticking.
causes: Ambient air temperature high.
Hot air from heater blowing onto accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor.
Expansion occurs within APP sensor.

steps: Remove APP sensor.
Check adaptor plate number Fig.101905.
If adaptor plate has part No. 1.165.708, it must be replaced.
Fit modified APP sensor.
ViewView more informationFig.101905

bulletins.title: AC/heater blower motor operating intermittently.
problems: AC/heater blower motor operating intermittently.
Interior lamp not working.
causes: Multifunction control module faulty.

steps: Carry out electrical, mechanical and component tests (as applicable) to eliminate any other possible cause(s).
If multifunction control module has following part number it must be replaced: 61 35 6 943 157, or 61 35 6 935 645.
Replacement multifunction control module will require programming using diagnostic equipment.

bulletins.title: Air conditioning (AC) inefficient.
problems: Air conditioning (AC) inefficient.
Noise from air conditioning (AC) when operating.
causes: Expansion valve contaminated with debris.

steps: Replace expansion valve.
Check AC high-pressure pipe for debris. Clean or replace AC pipe(s) as necessary.

bulletins.title: Boot lid opens without operating switch.
problems: Boot lid opens without operating switch.
causes: Water ingress into boot lid release actuator harness multi-plug through rear screen wiper motor spindle.
Boot lid release actuator short circuit.

steps: Renew rear screen wiper motor.
Check and clean harness multi-plug terminals.

bulletins.title: Brake lamps stay on when switching ignition off.
problems: Brake lamps stay on when switching ignition off.
causes: Multifunction control module faulty.

steps: Carry out electrical, mechanical and component tests (as applicable) to eliminate any other possible cause(s).
If no fault(s) found: Fit new multifunction control module.

bulletins.title: Clicking or creaking noise from front of vehicle when turning steering wheel or driving over uneven surfaces.
problems: Clicking or creaking noise from front of vehicle when turning steering wheel or driving over uneven surfaces.
causes: Front suspension turret distorted or damaged.
Front suspension strut upper mounting bush split or cracked.

steps: Check condition of front suspension turret for distortion or damage. Repair as necessary.
Check condition of front suspension strut upper mounting bush. Repair as necessary.

bulletins.title: Creaking noise from centre of fascia over uneven surfaces.
problems: Creaking noise from centre of fascia over uneven surfaces.
causes: Movement between fascia upper section and body panel.

steps: Remove fascia upper section.
Apply felt tape to fascia upper section guide pin Fig.121020.
Refit fascia upper section.
ViewView more informationFig.121020

bulletins.title: Door handles difficult to operate in very cold conditions.
problems: Door handles difficult to operate in very cold conditions.
causes: Door handle release cable frozen due to water ingress.

steps: Fit modified door handles.

bulletins.title: Door mirror glass movement restricted, when operating.
affected_vehicles: All models with electric door mirrors.
problems: Door mirror glass movement restricted, when operating.
causes: Door mirror wiring harness incorrectly routed.

steps: Re-route door mirror wiring harness as necessary.

bulletins.title: Electric power steering (EPS) inoperative.
affected_vehicles: All models with electric power steering (EPS).
problems: Electric power steering (EPS) inoperative.
causes: Water ingress into EPS pump motor connector.
Faulty EPS control module in pump.

steps: Disconnect battery earth lead.
Remove EPS pump motor connectors and check for water ingress.
If connections damaged replace harness and EPS pump motor.
If connections not damaged replace EPS pump motor only.

bulletins.title: Engine coolant leak from alternator area.
affected_vehicles: All models with W10 engine code, →12/03.
problems: Engine coolant leak from alternator area.
causes: Engine coolant hose chafes on alternator mounting bolt.

steps: Inspect engine coolant hose for damage and replace if necessary.

Check clearance between engine coolant hose and alternator mounting bolt:Ensure reference marks on engine coolant hose and coolant radiator are aligned Fig.119262.1.Ensure clearance of 8 mm minimum between engine coolant hose and alternator mounting bolt Fig.119262.2.
Ensure reference marks on engine coolant hose and coolant radiator are aligned Fig.119262.1.
Ensure clearance of 8 mm minimum between engine coolant hose and alternator mounting bolt Fig.119262.2.
Ensure reference marks on engine coolant hose and coolant radiator are aligned Fig.119262.1.
Ensure clearance of 8 mm minimum between engine coolant hose and alternator mounting bolt Fig.119262.2.
ViewView more informationFig.119262

bulletins.title: Engine idle speed drops when down-shifting between 3rd-2nd gears.
problems: Engine idle speed drops when down-shifting between 3rd-2nd gears.
causes: Engine control module (ECM) software fault.

steps: Carry out electrical, mechanical and component tests (as applicable) to eliminate any other possible cause(s).
If no fault(s) found: Program ECM with modified software using suitable diagnostic equipment.

notes: Note: To carry out an effective repair a software upgrade will be required - refer to manufacturer.

bulletins.title: Engine judder.
problems: Engine judder.
Poor acceleration from cold.
causes: Cold ambient air temperature.
Engine control module (ECM) software fault.

steps: Re-program ECM with upgraded software.

bulletins.title: Engine malfunction indicator lamp (MIL) illuminated.
affected_vehicles: All models with W10/W11 engine codes.
problems: Engine malfunction indicator lamp (MIL) illuminated.
Trouble code stored: P0128.
causes: Air lock in cooling system.

steps: Bleed cooling system.

bulletins.title: Engine oil pressure warning lamp illuminated while driving, even though oil level is correct.
affected_vehicles: All models with W10/W11 engine codes, →08/03.
problems: Engine oil pressure warning lamp illuminated while driving, even though oil level is correct.
causes: Engine wiring harness chafes against starter motor heat shield causing short circuit.

steps: Inspect engine wiring harness for chafing. Repair or replace engine wiring harness as necessary.
Fit modified starter motor heat shield.

bulletins.title: Engine runs in limp home mode.
affected_vehicles: All models with W10/W11 engine codes.
problems: Engine malfunction indicator lamp (MIL) illuminated.
Engine runs in limp home mode.
Possible trouble codes stored: P1125, P1226, P1692, P1693.
causes: Contaminated contacts on throttle motor harness multi-plug.
Poor connection in throttle motor harness multi-plug due to poor manufacture.
Internal failure of throttle motor.

steps: Fit new engine wiring harness.
Inspect production date code on throttle motor. If production date before 01/05/02, replace throttle motor.

bulletins.title: EPS pump overheating.
affected_vehicles: All models with electric power steering (EPS), 11/01-02/02.
problems: EPS pump overheating.
causes: Change to EPS auxiliary cooling fan specification.
Diode not being removed from harness when new EPS cooling fan fitted.

steps: Ensure diode removed when fitting new EPS cooling fan.
Disconnect battery earth lead.
Remove interior fuse box cover.
Unwrap harness, remove and discard diode.
Reconnect harness and insulate with tape.

bulletins.title: EPS pump overheating when ambient air temperature high.
affected_vehicles: All models with electric power steering (EPS), 2001-12/02.
problems: EPS pump overheating when ambient air temperature high.
Lack of power steering.
causes: EPS pump cooling fan not functioning after long journeys at high temperatures.

steps: Fit harness modification kit.

bulletins.title: Erratic instrument panel operation.
problems: Erratic instrument panel operation.
causes: Poor connection of instrument panel 12-pin multi-plug.

steps: Inspect instrument panel 12-pin multi-plug. If multi-plug fitted with transparent cover, replace with modified version.

bulletins.title: ESP warning lamp illuminated.
problems: ESP warning lamp illuminated.
TPMS warning lamp illuminated.
Trouble code related to steering angle sensor stored in fault memory.
causes: Steering angle sensor faulty.

steps: Fit new steering angle sensor.
Carry out steering angle sensor calibration using diagnostic equipment.

bulletins.title: Front seat heating too hot or cold.
affected_vehicles: All models with heated seats, with liner 12/01-03/04, without liner 12/01-12/03.
problems: Front seat heating too hot or cold.
causes: Seat heating element resistance too high/low.

steps: Fit adaptor harness to existing seat harness Fig.101903.1 & Fig.101903.2.
If seat heating too hot: Fit adaptor harness 61.100.152.025.
If seat heating too cold: Fit adaptor harness 61.100.152.026.
Secure harness to seat frame with cable tie Fig.101898.
ViewView more informationFig.101903
ViewView more informationFig.101898
ViewView more informationFig.101903
ViewView more informationFig.101898

bulletins.title: Fuel gauge not reading full when tank full.
problems: Fuel gauge not reading full when tank full.
causes: Fuel gauge tank sensor float arm bent.
Contamination on fuel gauge tank sensor resistor.

steps: Remove rear seat.
Remove fuel pump, fit modified left and right hand fuel gauge tank sensor kit.

bulletins.title: Glovebox opens when driving over rough roads.
problems: Glovebox opens when driving over rough roads.
Glovebox will not close.
causes: Glovebox latch does not engage with catch sufficiently.

steps: Remove glovebox.
Fit three 1 mm washers on each of the torx screws retaining the top edge of the glovebox. Fit washers between glovebox top edge and blue plastic nuts.

bulletins.title: Glovebox will not close.
problems: Glovebox opens when driving over rough roads.
Glovebox will not close.
causes: Glovebox latch does not engage with catch sufficiently.

steps: Remove glovebox.
Fit three 1 mm washers on each of the torx screws retaining the top edge of the glovebox. Fit washers between glovebox top edge and blue plastic nuts.

bulletins.title: Heater temperature control does not adjust temperature.
affected_vehicles: All models with manual temperature control.
problems: Heater temperature control does not adjust temperature.
causes: Heater air mix flap lever disconnected from flap shaft.

steps: Reconnect heater air mix flap lever under driver's side fascia.
Use small spot of glue to hold heater air mix flap lever in place.
ViewView more informationFig.109182

bulletins.title: Incorrectly diagnosed as instrument panel.
problems: Incorrectly diagnosed as instrument panel.
Rattling noise in area of bulkhead.
causes: Brake pipes are secured by two-part bracket.
When two parts of bracket come into contact rattling occurs.

steps: Insulate brake pipe securing bracket.
Remove coolant expansion tank Fig.101890.1 and power steering fluid reservoir Fig.101890.2.
Remove coolant expansion tank and power steering fluid reservoir carrier bracket Fig.101893.1.
Remove trim Fig.101893.2.
Fit felt strip between two parts of bracket Fig.101896.1.
Ensure two parts of bracket do not come into contact.
ViewView more informationFig.101890
ViewView more informationFig.101893
ViewView more informationFig.101896
ViewView more informationFig.101890
ViewView more informationFig.101893
ViewView more informationFig.101896

bulletins.title: Interior lamp not working.
problems: AC/heater blower motor operating intermittently.
Interior lamp not working.
causes: Multifunction control module faulty.

steps: Carry out electrical, mechanical and component tests (as applicable) to eliminate any other possible cause(s).
If multifunction control module has following part number it must be replaced: 61 35 6 943 157, or 61 35 6 935 645.
Replacement multifunction control module will require programming using diagnostic equipment.

bulletins.title: Intermittent operation of AC/heater function control panel.
problems: Intermittent operation of AC/heater function control panel.
causes: Poor earth connection for AC/heater function control panel.

steps: Locate and remove brown/black earth wire from position 26 of AC/heater function control panel harness multi-plug.
Connect new earth wire between AC/heater function control panel harness multi-plug and LH front door sill earth point.

bulletins.title: Knocking noise from front of vehicle when turning steering wheel.
problems: Knocking noise from front of vehicle when turning steering wheel.
causes: Power steering pump mounting bracket incorrectly positioned and hitting power steering rack.

steps: Slacken power steering pump mounting bracket retaining bolts Fig.119466.
Re-position power steering pump mounting bracket to ensure suitable clearance with power steering rack.
Tighten power steering pump mounting bracket retaining bolts. Tightening torque: 19 Nm.
ViewView more informationFig.119466

bulletins.title: Lack of power steering.
affected_vehicles: All models with electric power steering (EPS), 2001-12/02.
problems: EPS pump overheating when ambient air temperature high.
Lack of power steering.
causes: EPS pump cooling fan not functioning after long journeys at high temperatures.

steps: Fit harness modification kit.

bulletins.title: Noise from air conditioning (AC) when operating.
problems: Air conditioning (AC) inefficient.
Noise from air conditioning (AC) when operating.
causes: Expansion valve contaminated with debris.

steps: Replace expansion valve.
Check AC high-pressure pipe for debris. Clean or replace AC pipe(s) as necessary.

bulletins.title: Oil leak from transmission.
affected_vehicles: All models with continuously variable transmission (CVT).
problems: Oil leak from transmission.
causes: Transmission input shaft oil seal faulty.

steps: Fit new transmission input shaft oil seal.

bulletins.title: Poor acceleration from cold.
problems: Engine judder.
Poor acceleration from cold.
causes: Cold ambient air temperature.
Engine control module (ECM) software fault.

steps: Re-program ECM with upgraded software.

bulletins.title: Poor performance or failure of AC system.
affected_vehicles: All models with continuously variable transmission (CVT), →08/04.
problems: Poor performance or failure of AC system.
causes: AC pipe from condenser to evaporator chaffed through on transmission.

steps: Replace AC pipe.
Ensure suitable clearance between AC pipe and transmission.
Recharge AC system.

bulletins.title: Possible trouble codes stored: P1125, P1226, P1692, P1693.
affected_vehicles: All models with W10/W11 engine codes.
problems: Engine malfunction indicator lamp (MIL) illuminated.
Engine runs in limp home mode.
Possible trouble codes stored: P1125, P1226, P1692, P1693.
causes: Contaminated contacts on throttle motor harness multi-plug.
Poor connection in throttle motor harness multi-plug due to poor manufacture.
Internal failure of throttle motor.

steps: Fit new engine wiring harness.
Inspect production date code on throttle motor. If production date before 01/05/02, replace throttle motor.

bulletins.title: Rattling noise from clutch assembly with engine idling and transmission in neutral. Noise disappears when clutch pedal is depressed.
problems: Rattling noise from clutch assembly with engine idling and transmission in neutral. Noise disappears when clutch pedal is depressed.
causes: Dual mass flywheel faulty.

steps: Fit new dual mass flywheel.

bulletins.title: Rattling noise from rear seats when driving over rough roads.
affected_vehicles: All models with rear folding seats, →06/03.
problems: Rattling noise from rear seats when driving over rough roads.
causes: Faulty rear seat back rest latches.

steps: Replace rear seat back rest latches.

bulletins.title: Rattling noise in area of bulkhead.
problems: Incorrectly diagnosed as instrument panel.
Rattling noise in area of bulkhead.
causes: Brake pipes are secured by two-part bracket.
When two parts of bracket come into contact rattling occurs.

steps: Insulate brake pipe securing bracket.
Remove coolant expansion tank Fig.101890.1 and power steering fluid reservoir Fig.101890.2.
Remove coolant expansion tank and power steering fluid reservoir carrier bracket Fig.101893.1.
Remove trim Fig.101893.2.
Fit felt strip between two parts of bracket Fig.101896.1.
Ensure two parts of bracket do not come into contact.

ViewView more informationFig.101893
ViewView more informationFig.101896

bulletins.title: Rattling noise when opening front doors.
problems: Rattling noise when opening front doors.
causes: Excessive free play in window winder mechanism.

steps: Remove inner door panel.
Ensure window is fully closed.
Unseat rubber grommet from door and move aside Fig.119282.1.
Anti-rattle clip is fitted through access hole in door Fig.119282.2.
Hold anti-rattle clip with a pair of long nose pliers and install onto window winder mechanism through access hole Fig.119282.3.
Check smooth operation of window winder mechanism.
Refit rubber grommet.
Refit inner door panel.
ViewView more informationFig.119282

bulletins.title: Rear brakes binding.
problems: Rear brakes binding.
causes: Handbrake cable sticking due to poor routing.

steps: Lift vehicle.
Increase curve of handbrake cable on rear suspension arm until rear wheel turns freely.

notes: Note: Do not bend handbrake cable with excessive force.

bulletins.title: Slow response of navigation system display unit on start-up.
problems: Slow response of navigation system display unit on start-up.
causes: Faulty navigation system display unit.

steps: Fit modified navigation system display unit.

bulletins.title: Squeaking noise from slide/tilt sunroof when opening or closing.
problems: Squeaking noise from slide/tilt sunroof when opening or closing.
causes: Dirt ingress into sunroof slide/tilt mechanism.
Insufficient lubrication of sunroof slide/tilt mechanism.

steps: Clean sunroof outer guide rails and apply specified lubricant.
Operate sunroof several times.

bulletins.title: Squeaking noise from steering column when steering turned or when driving over rough roads.
problems: Squeaking noise from steering column when steering turned or when driving over rough roads.
causes: Steering column trim chafing on steering column.

steps: Remove steering column trims.
Apply felt tape to top of steering column assembly Fig.119273.
Apply felt tape to bottom of steering column assembly Fig.119273.
Refit steering column trims.
ViewView more informationFig.119273

bulletins.title: Stop lamps permanently illuminated.
problems: Stop lamps permanently illuminated.
causes: Water ingress into wiring harness due to AC evaporator drain tubes restricted or blocked.

steps: Check AC evaporator drain tubes for blockage, clean as necessary.
Check AC evaporator drain tubes are not restricted by wiring harness. Re-route wiring harness as necessary.
Check components for water damage and repair/replace as necessary.

bulletins.title: TPMS warning lamp illuminated.
problems: ESP warning lamp illuminated.
TPMS warning lamp illuminated.
Trouble code related to steering angle sensor stored in fault memory.
causes: Steering angle sensor faulty.

steps: Fit new steering angle sensor.
Carry out steering angle sensor calibration using diagnostic equipment.

bulletins.title: Trouble code related to steering angle sensor stored in fault memory.
problems: ESP warning lamp illuminated.
TPMS warning lamp illuminated.
Trouble code related to steering angle sensor stored in fault memory.
causes: Steering angle sensor faulty.

steps: Fit new steering angle sensor.
Carry out steering angle sensor calibration using diagnostic equipment.

bulletins.title: Trouble code stored: P0128.
affected_vehicles: All models with W10/W11 engine codes.
problems: Engine malfunction indicator lamp (MIL) illuminated.
Trouble code stored: P0128.
causes: Air lock in cooling system.

steps: Bleed cooling system.

bulletins.title: Vibration after fitting replacement exhaust.
problems: Vibration after fitting replacement exhaust.
causes: Vibration damper not fitted to replacement rear exhaust silencer.

steps: Vibration damper MUST be discarded when modified exhaust manifold fitted.
Vibration damper MUST be fitted and welded to pre-marked replacement rear silencer.
Fit damping bracket and align to pre-mark on exhaust.
Fit bolt Fig.101906.1. Tightening torque: 21 Nm.
Weld hole Fig.101906.2.
ViewView more informationFig.101906

notes: Note: VIN TC04342→ - modified exhaust manifold fitted.

bulletins.title: Vibration from area of gear lever.
problems: Vibration from area of gear lever.
causes: Gear lever remote cables not secured correctly.
Clearance between exhaust heat shield and gear lever cables too small.

steps: Remove exhaust heat shield.
Fit clip 10 cm from remote cable support Fig.101899.1.
Secure remote cables to support with cable tie Fig.101899.2.
Fit heat shield.
Ensure 10 mm clearance between heat shield Fig.101895.1 and remote cables Fig.101895.2.
Reshape heat shield if necessary.
ViewView more informationFig.101899
ViewView more informationFig.101895
ViewView more informationFig.101899
ViewView more informationFig.101895

bulletins.title: Vibration/rattle from tailgate over uneven surfaces.
problems: Vibration/rattle from tailgate over uneven surfaces.
causes: Poor manufacture of tailgate catch.
Hardening of tailgate bump stop rubber.

steps: If black tailgate catch not fitted:Fit modified tailgate catch.Fit modified tailgate latch bolts.
Fit modified tailgate catch.
Fit modified tailgate latch bolts.
Fit modified bump stops. Ensure bump stop protrudes 35 mm from tailgate.
Fit modified tailgate catch.
Fit modified tailgate latch bolts.

bulletins.title: Water ingress into load area.
problems: Water ingress into load area.
Water running down inside of rear screen.
causes: Centre stop lamp weather seal split or incorrectly fitted.

steps: Renew centre stop lamp assembly.

bulletins.title: Water running down inside of rear screen.
problems: Water ingress into load area.
Water running down inside of rear screen.
causes: Centre stop lamp weather seal split or incorrectly fitted.

steps: Renew centre stop lamp assembly.

bulletins.title: When opening boot lid water enters load area after heavy rain.
problems: When opening boot lid water enters load area after heavy rain.
causes: Unsatisfactory design of boot lid seal.

steps: Fit new boot lid seal.
